sect1.title: Obtaining necessary libraries
sect1.para: If you use maven as your build tool, you need to configure the correct dependencies for your project, as well as the repository configuration that tells maven where the jars are located.

sect2.title: Configuring maven

Make sure your maven installation has access to the axon repository, where the necessary jars and poms are located.
If you use a repository proxy, such as Artifactory, configure the following url: http://axonframework.googlecode.com/svn/repo

sect2.title: Additional dependencies
sect2.para: Most of the features provided by the Axon Framework are optional and require additional dependencies. We have chosen not to add these dependencies by default, as they would possibly clutter your project with stuff you don't need.

simplesect.title: Event Sourcing
simplesect.para: The event sourcing repository that is provided in Axon (XStreamFileSystemEventStore) requires XStream. You need to add the following maven dependency to your project to use this repository implementation.

simplesect.title: Spring Integration
simplesect.para: The Axon Framework provides connectors that allow you to publish events on a Spring Integration channel. These connectors require Spring Integration on the classpath. You need the following maven dependency to use these connectors.
